key_points: Navy Hospital Corpsman Maxton W. Soviak posthumously promoted to petty officer 3rd class.
Soviak was killed in an Islamic State attack at Kabul airport during the U.S. evacuation mission.
The attack occurred on Aug. 26, 2021, killing Soviak and 12 other U.S. service members.
Soviak also awarded the Purple Heart and Fleet Marine Force Corpsman warfare badge.
He was assigned to the 1st Marine Regiment, 1st Marine Division, Camp Pendleton, Calif.
Navy Secretary Carlos Del Toro recognized Soviak's dedication and service to the nation.
The attack was part of the events leading up to the end of the U.S. mission in Afghanistan.
U.S. and coalition forces evacuated over 124,000 people from Afghanistan starting in late July.
Soviak's remains were transferred at Dover Air Force Base, will arrive at Cleveland Hopkins International Airport.
A public procession for Soviak is planned to follow the arrival of his remains.
